content:
I've updated the contribution based on the forum comment ( https://forum.codingame.com/t/community-puzzle-go-competition/93113/26 ) and @jrl86's comment below.

Goal
* Revised the wording in "Area scoring": changed "intersections" to "points", changed "surrounded" to "completely enclosed", and added the note on not counting diagonals.

* Changed "transformation" to "marking the empty points" for clarity.

Output
* Swapped the first two lines as BLACK's score should be output first, not WHITE's.

* Added line numbers and reformatted the whole section.

* Removed the reminder that WHITE's score should end with ".5".

Hi
Nice puzzle, surprised to see nobdoy rised the point to clarify that Diagonals are not to be evaluated on surrounding check.

Good for me except for the output specification: the "ABC.X if X is not equal to zero else ABC" part is not great. The score is not always written on 3 digits  (you ask for "46.5", not "046.5"). The ".X" part is always ".5" for white and nothing for black, it would be better to say it like that instead of "if X!=0".

Also, what do you call a "stable position" (though that does not seem to matter much to solve the problem)?

> by counting wich one

a typo
By what would you replace that ? :)

Ok for the ABC.X part I'll correct that imediatly !

Yeah in GO you can have something like 

> .BW.
> W.BW
> BBBW
> ....

The W inside the BLACK block is considered "dead". I wanted to precise this part for players already knowing GO rules ...
Good point. I've amended the statement to mention that.
fixed that one and a few others
